channel.title: Shops Teleport Help [PI]
channel.description: I made a ::shops command that teleports you to the shops on my PI server. Every time you do dungeoneering, you can teleport out with that command and you can also do that above level 20 in wild. How can I fix this? The boolean is InDung

item.title: Shops Teleport Help [PI]
item.dc:creator: @jc22493 Jc22493
item.description:
@jc22493 wrote:

What Atomic basically did was make sure the player isn’t in the wild (!c.inWild) before allowing the command to continue.

Now, the inWild() method is probably one that contains the set of coordinates that are designated as the wilderness. In order to prevent players from teleporting from a dungeon, you’d have to do a similar check.

You’d have to declare a method, say, inDung() and specify a set of coordinates that the dungeon or dungeons are within, and when you’ve got that, you’d just need to perform the check.

Read full topic

item.title: Shops Teleport Help [PI]
item.dc:creator: @ExtremeX-Scape Ryley
item.description:
@ExtremeX-Scape wrote:

if (playerCommand.startsWith("shops")) {
    if (!c.inWild()) {
        c.getPA().movePlayer(2604, 3093, 0);
    }
}

You will need to add a Dungeoneering check yourself.

Read full topic

item.title: Shops Teleport Help [PI]
item.dc:creator: @akshayp1 akshayp1
item.description:
@akshayp1 wrote:

I dont get it.
This is the command, please change it to where you cant teleport by using this command in dung room and wild level 20+

if (playerCommand.startsWith(“shops”)) {
c.getPA().movePlayer(2604, 3093, 0);

}

Read full topic

I made a ::shops command that teleports you to the shops on my PI server. Every time you do dungeoneering, you can teleport out with that command and you can also do that above level 20 in wild. How can I fix this?
The boolean is InDung
